column4: Hmm, my dpkg is broken. It doesn't want to install stuff from command-line anymore
put the contents of your commands up on a pastebin for us to see
just aptitude (re)install randompackage
that's the command, we're interested in the output it generates
it's dutch...
that's fine .. i can translate
hmm, how did you ascertain that dpkg is broken then?
becasue it doesn't install it?
no idea?
what does this give you?  apt-cache policy monodevelop-query
heh -- see what ubottu just said ^^
why does it then display in the search results...
are you on intrepid?
it appears to be a virtual package - that's why - http://packages.ubuntu.com/search?suite=intrepid&keywords=monodevelop-query
seems like it is provided by monodevelop-database
hmm, well, do you still have that error message?
well, if you get it again .. come back and we'll see what we can do
are there nog logs of the update-manager?
errm, i dunno - i don't run a standard gnome desktop
maybe someone else knows?  but i doubt it anyway
can't find it, only plain logs of succesfull operations
